Carpet¶

Carpet is a sub-module used by main modular and contain three base class CarpetIOScalar, CarpetIOHDF5, and CarpetIOASCII. In Carpet we will deal with them separately, because their data structure is completely different. These class focused on the data file. Fetch all useful information from these files.

In order to reduce the complexity of the code, These class does not depend on the main modular and can be used alone.

We’re going to get started by loading up necessary modular and specify some example file in my local computer to demonstrate the function of this module.

[1]:

path = '/Users/liuyu/simulations/BH/'
HDF5_file = path + 'ml_admconstraints-ml_mom.xy.h5' # It also can be a list of HDF5 file
Scalar_file = path + 'ml_admconstraints-ml_mom.maximum.asc' # It also can be a list of Scalar file
ASCII_file = path + 'ml_admconstraints-ml_mom.x.asc' # It also can be a list of Scalar file
from CactusTool.Carpet import CarpetIOScalar
from CactusTool.Carpet import CarpetIOHDF5
from CactusTool.Carpet import CarpetIOASCII

CarpetIOScalar¶

First view all available variables in a given reduction operation.

[2]:

ds_scalar = CarpetIOScalar(Scalar_file)
print(ds_scalar)

Available maximum timeseries:
['M1', 'M2', 'M3']

Then specify variables and their corresponding operations.

[3]:

var = ds_scalar.max['M1']
print(var.varfiles)

{'M1': ['/Users/liuyu/simulations/BH/ml_admconstraints-ml_mom.maximum.asc']}

Note: When specify variable name, we just simple filter it by use string ``in`` method in python. So you can specify a vector or tensor like following.

[4]:

var = ds_scalar.max['M']
print(var.varfiles)

Please make sure dict_keys(['M1', 'M2', 'M3']) belong the same group
{'M1': ['/Users/liuyu/simulations/BH/ml_admconstraints-ml_mom.maximum.asc'], 'M2': ['/Users/liuyu/simulations/BH/ml_admconstraints-ml_mom.maximum.asc'], 'M3': ['/Users/liuyu/simulations/BH/ml_admconstraints-ml_mom.maximum.asc']}

Following are some attribute of this variable you may need:

Dataset¶

These dataset may store in different files and one file may contain many variables. Pandas DataFrame is a powerful tool to combine them and remove duplicate data.

dataset is a method, because sometime we need use different way to combine data. We use pd.concat to do it. Following are some example.

  • Whether add additional key index about filename

[5]:

var.dataset(key=False)

[5]:
iteration time M1 M2 M3
0 0.0 0.0 6.911620 23.938131 0.730308
1 256.0 1.0 4.690899 6.131249 1.355362
2 512.0 2.0 8.159930 8.806923 2.408183
3 768.0 3.0 16.974336 16.485445 2.944662
4 1024.0 4.0 19.698239 14.367274 4.194277
... ... ... ... ... ...
65 16640.0 65.0 27.362242 14.835847 10.510170
66 16896.0 66.0 34.752490 10.354096 8.157228
67 17152.0 67.0 41.331741 9.649753 7.046484
68 17408.0 68.0 56.774063 7.861392 8.128903
69 17664.0 69.0 86.641334 9.599766 10.149837

70 rows × 5 columns

[6]:

var.dataset()

[6]:
iteration time M1 M2 M3
ml_admconstraints-ml_mom.maximum.asc 0 0.0 0.0 6.911620 23.938131 0.730308
1 256.0 1.0 4.690899 6.131249 1.355362
2 512.0 2.0 8.159930 8.806923 2.408183
3 768.0 3.0 16.974336 16.485445 2.944662
4 1024.0 4.0 19.698239 14.367274 4.194277
... ... ... ... ... ...
65 16640.0 65.0 27.362242 14.835847 10.510170
66 16896.0 66.0 34.752490 10.354096 8.157228
67 17152.0 67.0 41.331741 9.649753 7.046484
68 17408.0 68.0 56.774063 7.861392 8.128903
69 17664.0 69.0 86.641334 9.599766 10.149837

70 rows × 5 columns

For more pd.concat parameter you can see https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/user_guide/merging.html

Preview¶

It is best to run var.dataset and check the dataset by eye before executing the following command. We use pandas.DataFrame.plot() to do it. Following are some example.

[7]:

var.preview(subplots=True)

For more pandas.DataFrame.plot() parameter you can see https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/version/0.23.4/generated/pandas.DataFrame.plot.html

CarpetIOHDF5¶

[8]:

ds = CarpetIOHDF5(HDF5_file)

[9]:

ds.files

[9]:

['/Users/liuyu/simulations/BH/ml_admconstraints-ml_mom.xy.h5']
